schema:creator: Catholic Church
schema:description:
Provenance: Family of Jehan Chac√®re (1497); Pierre Picard le jeune (1530); Alex Scott Carter, "MS No. 2" (1907); acquired by UC Davis from Francis Edwards at the 8th California Antiquarian Book Faire (September 1972). 

 Languages: Latin; French 

 Notes: ff. 8-19v Calendar; ff. 20-57v Hours of BVM; ff. 58-69v Penitential pss & litany; ff. 70-91 Office of the Dead; ff. 91v-99v Obsecro te, O Intemerata, suffrages of Michael, John the Baptist, Sebastian, Margaret, Barbara, Stephen, Lawrence, Anne, Mary Magd. 

 Physical Description: ff. i + 97 + i - Plain red morocco, twentieth century. Parchment - 206 x 155 mm - 21-22 long lines ruled in pale red ink. Hours of the BVM begin defectively; foliation skips 6, 7 to allow for stubs. 

 Information for this description kindly supplied by D. J. Dutschke and C. W. Dutschke.
schema:material: ff. i + 97 + i - Plain red morocco, twentieth century. Parchment - 206 x 155 mm - 21-22 long lines ruled in pale red ink
schema:name: Hours of the Virgin, in Latin, preceded by a Calendar in French, and followed by the Pentential Psalms and Litany, the Office of the Dead, and prayers to the Virgin and memorials for Saints, in Latin.
schema:publisher: UC Davis, Archives and Special Collections
